title: In what ratio are hydrogen and oxygen atoms in carbohydrates? - Quora

response.answer_text: 2:1 A carbohydrate () is a biomolecule consisting of carbon (C), hydrogen (H), and oxygen (O) atoms, usually with a hydrogen-oxygen atom ratio of 2:1 (as in water) and thus with the empirical formula Cm(H2O)n (where m may be different from n). Biological Discussions. Please Follow Us. Thanks, A Lot in this regard.
